node.statement: (mu_eps ~ mu_0) Combining nodes 1.2.2 and 1.2.3: mu_eps has density d(mu_eps)/d(mu_0)(phi) = Z_eps^{-1} exp(-V_eps(phi)) with respect to mu_0. Since Z_eps is in (0, infinity) (node 1.2.3) and exp(-V_eps(phi)) > 0 for mu_0-a.e. phi (node 1.2.2), the density is strictly positive mu_0-a.e. A probability measure with strictly positive density w.r.t. a reference measure is equivalent to it: for any measurable A, mu_eps(A) = integral_A Z_eps^{-1} exp(-V_eps) dmu_0 = 0 if and only if mu_0(A) = 0, since the integrand is strictly positive mu_0-a.e. Hence mu_eps ~ mu_0 for each eps > 0.
